item.title: 英国政府要求各部门节省开支以资助身份证计划
item.description: 英国政府要求各部委削减部门开支，以筹措资金推行一项备受争议的新数字身份证计划。【原文：The UK government has asked ministers to find reductions in their departmental spending in order to fund a controversial new digital ID program.】

item.title: 美国炼油商成为特朗普委内瑞拉计划的早期赢家
item.description: 本周，美国部分最大石油加工企业的股价大幅上涨。【原文：Shares of some of the largest American oil processors have surged this week.】

item.title: 墨西哥央行降息后通胀降幅超预期
item.description: 墨西哥12月年度通胀率降幅超出预期，这为政策制定者在最近一次会议上决定下调基准利率提供了支撑。【原文：Mexican annual inflation slowed more than expected in December, supporting policymakers’ decisions to cut their benchmark interest rate at their last meeting.】

item.title: 国防类股再度飙升，特朗普计划增加军事预算
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德·特朗普计划要求增加美国军事预算，这为全球国防类股票注入了新的动力，欧洲国防股在这一年伊始表现尤为强劲，而今年似乎将由地缘政治主导。【原文：President Donald Trump’s plans to request an increase in the US military budget is giving a fresh boost to defense stocks around the world, with those in Europe having a particularly strong start to a year that looks set to be dominated by geopolitics.】

item.title: 肥胖症、并购、生物技术复兴：2026年健康股投资指南
item.description: 美国股市的医疗保健板块历来被视为防御性板块，这得益于该行业支柱企业稳定的增长和健康的股息收益率。但这种认知正在改变。【原文：The health-care corner of the US equity market has traditionally been viewed as defensive, thanks to steady growth and healthy dividend yields among the industry’s stalwarts. That narrative is changing.】

item.title: TikTok风波悄然走向低调结局
item.description: 欢迎阅读《科技深度》——彭博社全球记者团队每日为您带来的科技商业资讯。今日，亚历山德拉·S·莱文报道称，随着TikTok被出售给美国投资者，美国禁止该应用的努力似乎已告终结。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Alexandra S. Levine reports on what appears to be the end of the effort to ban TikTok in the US with a sale to American investors.】

item.title: 新兴市场股票与货币下跌，地缘政治风险加剧
item.description: 新兴市场股票和货币连续第二日下跌，因地缘政治风险上升令交易员在关键美国就业数据公布前保持谨慎。【原文：Emerging-market stocks and currencies fell for a second day as rising geopolitical risks turned traders cautious a day before key US jobs data.】

item.title: 日本债务负担在经济复苏中跌至16年新低
item.description: 经济增长加上物价上涨推动国内生产总值增长，同时缩减国家债务。【原文：Economic growth plus rising prices propel GDP and shrink the country’s debt.】

item.title: 申请美国关税退税的企业数量激增
item.description: 好市多和固特异轮胎已加入退款诉讼战，都乐鲜果和J.Crew亦然。【原文：Costco and Goodyear Tire jumped into the legal fray for refunds, as have Dole Fresh Fruit and J. Crew】

item.title: 美国商人指南：最高法院即将出台的关税裁决
item.description: 最高法院即将就特朗普总统四月推出的全面关税措施是否合法作出裁决，该举措曾短暂引发市场震荡，这将成为美国股市和债市面临的下一个重大考验。【原文：An upcoming Supreme Court ruling on the legality of the sweeping tariffs that President Donald Trump rolled out in April, briefly sending shockwaves through markets, looms as one of the next big tests for US stocks and bonds.】

item.title: 银行竞相为Advent收购InPost提供45亿欧元债务融资
item.description: 银行家们正争相参与一笔高达45亿欧元（53亿美元）的债务融资计划，该计划旨在支持由Advent International牵头的财团收购波兰包裹柜运营商InPost SA。此举拉开了并购与杠杆融资市场预计将迎来重大一年的序幕。【原文：Bankers are jostling for a spot on a debt package of up to €4.5 billion ($5.3 billion) backing a potential takeover of Polish parcel locker operator InPost SA by a consortium including Advent International, kicking off what’s expected to be a big year for M&A and the leveraged finance market.】

item.title: 柬埔寨称美方官员将赴柬协助停火谈判
item.description: 柬埔寨外交部长表示，美国代表团将于近日访问柬埔寨，协助巩固该国与泰国之间脆弱的停火协议。【原文：A US delegation will visit Cambodia in the coming days to help fortify a fragile ceasefire with Thailand, the Southeast Asian nation’s top diplomat said.】

item.title: 首席鼓吹者卷土重来，撼动市场
item.description:
特朗普在社交媒体上的猛烈抨击再次给投资者和交易员的生活带来困扰。

【原文：

Trump’s social media blasts once again complicate life for investors, traders.

】

item.title: 智利降息后消费者价格跌幅超预期
item.description: 智利12月消费者价格指数降幅超出预期，这印证了政策制定者上月决定将基准利率下调25个基点的正确性——这是该国2025年第二次降息。【原文：Chile’s consumer prices dropped more than expected in December, corroborating policymakers’ decision to lower the key interest rate last month by a quarter point for the second time in 2025.】

item.title: 克罗地亚提名央行行长武伊奇奇竞选欧洲央行副行长职位
item.description: 克罗地亚正式提名博里斯·武伊契奇担任欧洲中央银行副行长一职，该机构第二把交椅的角逐正日趋白热化。【原文：Croatia formally nominated Boris Vujcic for the role of vice president of the European Central Bank as the race for the No. 2 job at the institution heats up.】

item.title: 美国年底取消裁员计划，未来将增加招聘
item.description: 美国企业上月宣布的裁员人数减少，同时计划增加招聘，这可能缓解了人们对劳动力市场急剧放缓的担忧。【原文：US companies announced fewer layoffs last month while planning more hiring, potentially easing fears of a sharper slowdown in the labor market.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长吉多斯称利率水平恰当，不确定性极高
item.description: 欧洲央行副行长路易斯·德·金多斯表示，当前利率处于合理水平，但他警告称地缘政治事件正带来"巨大不确定性"。【原文：European Central Bank Vice President Luis de Guindos said interest rates are at an appropriate level, though he warned of “enormous uncertainty” due to geopolitical events.】

item.title: 高盛预计美国消费者将推动2026年股市更广泛上涨
item.description: 华尔街的策略师们正寻求新的增长引擎来推动美国股市的牛市，因为市场对人工智能板块放缓的担忧日益加剧。【原文：Strategists across Wall Street are looking for new engines to power the bull market in American stocks, amid concerns about a slowdown in the artificial intelligence trade.】

item.title: 英国企业价格与薪资预期小幅回落，为英国央行注入动力
item.description: 英国企业预计未来12个月将略微降低员工薪资涨幅，同时小幅上调商品价格。这对仍对高通胀预期保持警惕的英国央行官员而言，无疑是个积极信号。【原文：UK businesses expect to hand workers slightly smaller pay rises and hike prices by less over the next 12 months, an encouraging sign for Bank of England officials who remain wary over elevated expectations.】

item.title: 2025年最佳股票交易持续走强，问题在于能持续多久
item.description: 2025年股市最火热的板块在新的一年依然炙手可热，但这股势不可挡的涨势让部分华尔街专业人士开始质疑：是否即将迎来反转？【原文：The hottest corner of the stock market in 2025 remains scorching in the new year, but the relentless momentum has some Wall Street pros wondering if a reversal is coming.】

item.title: 高盛策略师称高估值令股市面临风险
item.description: 高盛集团策略师指出，当前股票交易溢价过高，若市场对经济增长的担忧加剧，将使股市面临风险。【原文：Equities are trading at lofty premiums, putting stocks at risk in the event that concerns over economic growth increase, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc. strategists.】

item.title: 惨淡圣诞季令英国零售业雪上加霜
item.description: 英国三大零售商在圣诞季遭遇严峻挑战，消费者需求波动剧烈，价格竞争异常激烈。【原文：Three of Britain’s biggest retailers faced a tough Christmas marked by volatile consumer demand and intense price competition.】

item.title: 马来西亚在关键党内会议前撤销副总理贪腐案
item.description: 马来西亚总检察长办公室表示，将不再对副总理阿末扎希的贪污案采取进一步行动，理由是缺乏足够证据对其提起公诉。【原文：Malaysia’s Attorney General’s Chambers said it would take no further action against Deputy Prime Minister Ahmad Zahid Hamidi in relation to his graft case, citing insufficient evidence to prosecute him.】

item.title: 新加坡星展银行为重大风险转移奠定基础
item.description: 星展集团控股有限公司正考虑进军重大风险转移市场，随着贷款机构越来越多地转向此类交易以推动增长和吸收冲击。【原文：DBS Group Holdings Ltd. is weighing a foray into the market for significant risk transfers as lenders increasingly turn to such deals as a way to drive growth and absorb shocks.】

item.title: 汇丰银行同意支付3亿欧元以了结法国税务分红调查
item.description: HSBC Holdings Plc has agreed to pay about €300 million ($350 million) to settle a twin criminal and tax case in France into its alleged role in the “Cum-Cum” scandal that’s embroiled some of the biggest banks in the country.

item.title: 法国农民开着拖拉机前往巴黎抗议自由贸易协定
item.description: 法国农民驾驶数十辆拖拉机开赴埃菲尔铁塔等巴黎地标，向政府施压要求其不要支持欧盟与南美国家达成的自由贸易协定。【原文：French farmers drove dozens of tractors to the Eiffel Tower and other Parisian landmarks to pressure the government not to support a European Union free-trade deal with South American nations.】

item.title: 欧洲人工智能竞赛点燃数据中心支持债券市场
item.description: 随着欧洲地区努力在人工智能产业蓬勃发展的浪潮中迎头赶上美国，今年将有一系列由欧洲数据中心支持的债务交易陆续进入市场。【原文：A spate of debt deals backed by European data centers is set to come to market this year as the region strives to catch up with the US in the race to capitalize on the booming artificial intelligence industry.】

item.title: 2025年因担忧特朗普政策，外国投资者争相抢购日本股票
item.description: Foreign investors flocked to Japanese equities last year, purchasing the most since 2013 as they sought refuge from US economic uncertainty under President Donald Trump.

item.title: 摩根大通的买入建议引发南非食品生产商股价上涨
item.description: 南非食品生产商股价攀升至近八年高点，此前摩根大通公司建议买入该类股票，理由是其前景强劲。【原文：South African food producers climbed to an almost eight-year high after JPMorgan Chase & Co. recommended buying the stock, citing robust prospects.】

item.title: 意大利2026年首轮国债拍卖吸引1900亿欧元认购
item.description: 意大利正通过发行两期欧元债券启动其2026年融资计划，借势欧洲其他地区政治不确定性重塑资金流向之际，投资者对其债务的强劲需求。【原文：Italy is kicking off its 2026 funding program with a dual-tranche euro bond sale, capitalizing on strong investor demand for its debt as political uncertainty elsewhere in Europe reshapes flows.】
